headline.main: Sony Pictures CEO: Call to Google Got 'The Interview' Out
headline.print_headline: Sony Pictures CEO: Call to Google Got 'The Interview' Out

docs.lead_paragraph: The network was crippled. Days before Thanksgiving, Sony Pictures employees had logged onto computers that flashed a grim message from a hacker group calling itself Guardians of Peace. Soon personal information for tens of thousands of current and former workers was dumped online, including Social Security numbers and the purported salaries of top executives. Five Sony-produced movies, including the unreleased "Annie," appeared on file-sharing websites. Thousands of private, and sometimes embarrassing, emails hit the Internet.

headline.main: Student Sues U. Of Oregon After Claiming Rape by Players
headline.print_headline: Student Sues U. Of Oregon After Claiming Rape by Players

docs.lead_paragraph: A woman who says she was sexually assaulted by three University of Oregon basketball players filed a lawsuit Thursday against the school and head basketball coach Dana Altman.

headline.main: Western Ukrainians hold patriotic Christmas celebration
headline.sub: Western Ukrainians hold patriotic Christmas celebration

docs.lead_paragraph: Residents of the western Ukrainian city of Lviv and people displaced from the east take part in a traditional Christmas procession with a patriotic twist. Deborah Lutterbeck reports.

headline.main: Controversial Beale Signs With Wallabies Through World Cup
headline.print_headline: Controversial Beale Signs With Wallabies Through World Cup

docs.lead_paragraph: Versatile back Kurtley Beale, who was at the heart of the text message scandal that led to Australia rugby coach Ewen McKenzie's resignation last year, has signed on for another season with the Wallabies.

headline.main: New York Shifts Into 'Code Blue' to Get Homeless Off Frigid Streets
headline.print_headline: New York Shifts Into 'Code Blue' to Get Homeless Off Frigid Streets

docs.lead_paragraph: With temperatures in New York expected to plummet again on Thursday night, the city is putting into effect its "Code Blue" emergency measures for the third night in a row to get thousands of homeless people off the streets and into warm shelters.

headline.main: Couple Accused of Caging Autistic Son, 19, Make Plea Deal
headline.print_headline: Couple Accused of Caging Autistic Son, 19, Make Plea Deal

docs.lead_paragraph: A couple accused of keeping their 19-year-old adopted son in a cage at their home in rural eastern Michigan made a plea deal Thursday and face sentencing in March.
